24717466.review:
“Woah, what a rush…”

That's usually how I'm feeling after each session of SEUM: An addictive, fast-paced quake/unreal style 3D platforming non-parkour adventure.

I've been following this game's development for some time and was very interested in this project fully intending to buy it at the very generous offering of $15. However, I was offered a review copy of this game and I really want to do the developers justice for their kindness and hard work.

There are a large number of games that have clearly inspired SEUM which in turn honors and borrows from. The most obvious will be Quake/Doom/Unreal based on the speed, camera, power-ups, and overall theme. There are also elements from 2D platformers such as the Jumper series and Super Meat Boy re-imagined in 3D. Finally, you can’t help but feel games like Mirror’s Edge and Counter-Strike Surfing have also shaped this experience. 

The story is here for half filler and half theme. I’m not going to elaborate on it too much because I don’t feel it’s important. Just imagine you’re just a cool, nerdy, broski who really likes beer who can run faster than he realistically is able to.

Each level is expertly crafted to slowly teach you the rules of the game gradually over time. I never found myself struggling on any particular level, except my own desire to beat a level as fast as I possibly could and score some killer top times and trying to beat my own personal bests, or my friend’s.

To elaborate further, the game handles and performs like a dream which is crucial to the experience. Framerates are high, and controls are tight and accurate. The game NEVER feels unfair or cheats you out of anything. Everything is orchestrated and based on patterns. In order to achieve a higher time, you may need to wait to start the level after a few seconds and try different approaches to your problem solving and skills.

If you ever get tired from the rush of running really, really fast, the game has the perfect opportunity to allow you to slow down and relax and hunt down the hidden beer cans on each stage. This is a really great escaped, especially when you’re stressed because you can’t shed .300 of a time on that one level to make it to the top 10.

The audio is great, not much to say there. I think the soundtrack is OK, nothing amazing here, but it sets the mood and gets you into the groove.

As far as bugs and glitches are concerned, there have been a few instances where I noticed that when I scored a best time locally, the time was .011 or so faster than it was on my local time; not sure why this happened. 

I see myself coming back to play SEUM time and time again for fun and maybe beating some of my PBs when I feel the itch. I’m really hoping for either a sequel or DLC because I’ve tasted lava, spikes, acid, and fire baby, and I want more, more, more!

24717437.review:
This game is spectacular. I've never really tried speedrunning anything at all before this game, now I'm spending my free time trying to top the leaderboards in as many levels as I can. 

The game starts out pretty easy but slowly ramps up in difficulty. Simply finishing most levels is pretty simple, but getting top times is really, really hard. The best routes are sometimes not at all obvious, and you'll have to spend some time thinking on how to optimize your route. You get a lot of joy out of even just beating your own times and improving your skills on a level, even if you can't quite hit the top of the leaderboards. I've spent hours on a single level trying to get just a few more milliseconds off my time to get under 3.400 or something.

If you want a game with good humor mixed with metal music/themes mixed with tons of replayability, even if you don't think you'd be into speedrunning, I highly recommend this.

24698991.review:
[b][u]A Hella Fun Game[/u][/b]

[b]Setting:[/b]
You're playing the metalhead and beer lover named Marty whose beer gets stolen by Satan. Due to a conflict between Marty and Satan, Marty now has Satan's arm which he sews on it's own and gains the powers of Satan. Then he starts to fight his way through hell to get to his beloved beer.

[b]Content:[/b]
The game contains 100 levels, a speedrun mode and an endless mode. Every level includes a collectable you need to achieve a completition of 100% of the game, plus some levels have well hidden secrets.
All in all I assume the game has well over 20 hours of content.

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
The first person perspective is chosen and the gameplay is exceedingly fast paced (which you can obviously conclude out of the game's title). Beyond that you will unlock five powers (shooting fireballs, flying, teleportation, time leaps and a platform genertor) ehancing the gameplay significantly and making it pretty challenging.
In addition it's very smooth and I've not experienced any input lag.

[b]Atmosphere:[/b]
Well it's a pretty dark setting due to taking place in hell. The metal soundtrack is just great and harmonizes perfectly with the setting and artstyle. Also the game's humour is hilarious.

[b]Recommendation:[/b]
I highly recommend the game for those who like:
[list]
[*]to try over and over again
[*]to play under pressure of time
[*]metal
[*]secrets
[*]fast paced and challenging gameplay
[*]jump n' runs/platformers
[/list]

(I am sorry for grammatical and orthographical mistakes. English is not my native language.)

9/10

Redneck gets robbed of all his beer by the Devil, and looses his arm while trying to get it back. He than quickly reacts and cuts the Devils own arm off in return before the Devil slips back into Hell. The Redneck attaches the devils arm to his own and chases after the devil through Hell to get his beer back, wihle getting the oppurtonity to weild awesome devil powers to navigate through the different levels of hell as quickly as possible.

That is the plot behind this game, how can you not get exited to play this game. It is a steal paying 15 dollars for this game. I have already put over 4 hours into it, and am only about half way through the game. The controls are smooth, the levels are challenging and daverse. There are different modes to play through, and some wicked powers to help over come challenges as quick as possilbe. There is a running leaderboard on each level, to show where you rank up against the world for time. It is addictive and so much fun.

The only reason this isnt a perfect 10 is because there are some slight flaws with the game. The big one is that later through the game, the hidden beer cans are insanly hard to find unless you stumble across them by accident. The second  time objective is usally understanbly hard to get, but its fair, except for a choosen few levels, to where you have to be near perfect to grab the time needed for the medal. Usally when you run into those issues there are shortcuts you just havnt found yet, but there are a few levels where there are no shortcuts and you just have to be that good which is a bit unfair in my opinion.

Outside of that, this game is amazing and everyone who enjoys first person shooters or games like Portal, should play this game.

24680629.review:
SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell is fast. Deaths are fast, levels are fast, the story is fast. One moment, Satan's stolen your 
beer, the next, you're using his severed hand to traverse hellish platforms. 

In this game, you jump, teleport and bounce across well crafted maps in an attempt to return your stolen beer. Of course, thanks to often brutal time limits in each map, you have to complete 'em fast, making the platform heavy gameplay frantic and fast. Thankfully, the controls are smooth like butter, so jumping about hell feels excellent, and levels are crafted in a way that makes them both difficult and fun to complete.

But if the platforming is a bit to difficult, and you find yourself getting frustrated, the game has your back. Not only is the game funny, with the dialogue of the protagonist, A beer drinking metalhead, as well as the cruel jabs from Satan when you inevitably fail, keeping you cheerful as you go through. It also helps that the music is damn fine, with a pumping metal soundtrack to keep you moving at a fast pace.

It's smooth, it's addicting as hell (Pun intended), and for it's price, there's a damn good amount of content on show with so many levels to complete.

I heartily recommend it!

24647954.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell is the development debut of Pine Studio and has been published by Headup Games. I’ve seen my share of crazy plots in video games but SEUM takes the cake and eats it in one bite. You literally go to Hell and back, to recover a stolen case of beer. If that isn’t a fresh start for this genre, then I don’t know what else might be.
 
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Apparently Hell is like a Japanese Game Show minus the gratuitous nudity. Nicely detailed obstacle courses mixed with intuitive and responsive controls, make trial & error less of a certainty once you become accustomed to the game’s first few levels. It encourages a fast paced gameplay even if you’re not forced down this road and you can settle for a more relaxed approach (as if sightseeing the Infernal domains has any resemblance to a relaxing activity). If constant running and jumping through portals seemed like “been there, done that” you can also swing fireballs at certain obstacles/objects and it is precisely this break from traditional 3D platforming, that helps SEUM truly stand out. Its ludicrous storyline is the cherry on top, at this point.
 
The game looks and sounds exactly as you’d expect from a beer-recovery trip to Hell. Well textured deadly traps and a lot of quality Heavy Metal tracks, to constantly reinforce the game’s high strung rhythm. That being said, with over 100 levels to choose along with several game modes, the sights do become repetitive (and especially so if you’re an achievement collector) but that is not enough to mark it as a con.
 
[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Beautiful graphics and soundtrack
+ Challenging and diversified gameplay
+ Steam Achievements & Trading Cards
 
[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Minor lag issues on later levels
 
[h1]Result / Final thoughts[/h1]
SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell is indeed a well deserved breath of fresh (as far as fire and brimstone allow it) air for any fan of modern platformers. This isn’t just another fast-paced parkour game with an infernal skin all over. It features a novel story and has you hunting for beer cans and achievements alike. It even provides the Cards necessary for a Steam Badge and has an in-game bonus section. I’m certain that even the rare lag issues I had on some levels, will be sorted out in future updates. The game as it is now, it needs little improvement and can provide countless hours of fun. Don’t let Satan drink up your beer.
 
[b]Rating 8/10[/b]
 
[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/elitegives]Elite Giveaways[/url], check us out for more reviews ranging from Indie games to AAA titles.[/quote]

24631718.review:
SEUM: Прямиком из Ада

Данную игру я еще заметил задолго до выхода в стим, понравились скрины и вообще сама тема. Музло+раннер.
После ее выхода, было бы странно не купить. Игра оказалась действительно хорошей и проработанной.
История рассказывает об обычном работяге, который любил пить пивко лежа на диване, но в один из таких обычных дней, ему под дверь подсунули пластинку, которую можно было просто выкинуть и пить дальше, но нет. Магнитофон для пластинок есть в каждом трейлере в США, то почему бы не поставить. В итоге к нам из пластинки КАРЛ! вышел сам дьявол, мы его освободили и он решил поразвлечься\отдохнуть, забрав все пиво ГГ и еще успев отрезать руку, но наш герой не промах и напоследок швыряет пластинку и режет ту же руку, что и отрубили ему. Жаль не ногу или голову. Недолго думая, привязывает цепью руку к себе, она срастается и он еще отправляется на поиски этого же дьявола. По пустым банкам из под пива он находит канализацию, и тут наша игра и начинается.
Наша задача спуститься в самый низ ада, пройти все его круги и лабиринты, но найти того демона и вернуть свое пиво.

Игра выглядит красивой, красного в игре хватает. Саундтрек подобран на все 100%, просто идеальный. Играть в наушниках одно удовольствие.
Так же физика мне напомнила почему-то Квейк. Очень хотелось сделать распрыжку, но это сложно.
Суть игры пройти уровень, как можно быстрее, заработав 2 черева (серебряный и еще быстрее - золотой), так же есть секреты на уровнях, не в каждом, но есть.
Даже босс-уровень имеется, но самого босса нет. Просто завершающий перед спуском на этаж ниже.

Итог:
Игра понравилась, своих денег стоит, фанатам раннеров и вообще металла будет играть одно удовольствие.
Для остальные есть достижения и карточки.

п.с. Не уверен, но мне кажется в том самом месте, откуда пришел дьявол, пиво должно быть всегда.

24624932.review:
SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 
Marty is an early-riser; he usually wake up at 11am. However, today it’s a late morning for Marty; after a struggle to find the edge of his bed and make his breakfast, it’s nearly midday! What a dreadful start to the day. It didn’t take long for our friend to rediscover his smile as soon as he sat down on his favourite sofa. Then a knock on the door . . . “Who the hell is knocking on my door so early this morning,” thought Marty? Before reaching the knob, the door violently pulverised itself, and a Demon appeared in front of him. The Demon is after Marty’s beer reserves and a mighty brawl ensues between them. Marty loses his right arm in the fight but manages to inflict a major blow to the Demon, who in turn loses an arm too!  After stitching the demon’s arm to his own body, it is time to retrieve his beer reserves. . . Time to go to “HELL”

Seum: Speedrunners from Hell is a FPS/Platformer/Parkour where you play Marty, an easy-going person who has been robbed of his beer reserve by a demon from Hell! 

After a cartoon-style introduction, you will arrive in Hell’s main menu. From here, you will be able to choose between 3 modes of play. The first one is single player; this mode consists of one hundred levels divided into nines floors.  The main objective in each of the levels is to go as fast as you can to the round blue portal without dying, and to find the hidden beer can, too. When you reach the 10 levels in each floor, you will unlock the boss level and upon clearing this level, you will be able to jump on the elevator to go down deeper into hell!

The second mode is a speedrun parkour where you will need to clear all the levels from one floor as fast as you can, and the time will be added to the end of each level.

The last one is the endless level. In this mode, you will need to accumulate meters without dying - a Hell of a mode.

I really enjoy the gameplay; the levels are fast and short and they become ever more challenging as you travel down to hell. As I mentioned above, you have to go as fast as you can to the blue portal with a time limit. If you manage to do half way through the time limit you will score a “HELL YEAH” demon symbol on that level. Then you will need to restart the level to find the hidden beer can. You must have a specific number of beer cans and demon symbols on each floor to unlock the boss level and the elevator. Marty has the ability to shoot fireballs with his new arm (a Hell of an arm) but will also find on certain parkours a teleporting or a gravity ability to be able to reach the portal. And yes, you will have plenty of obstacles to avoid. You also have a leader board, so if you fancy seeing your name at the top, you will need to be superfast. This game is really fun!

Great graphics accompanied with a hard rock soundtrack. The controls are fine and responsive and the game is very addictive. 

Positive:
~~~~~~ 

-	Great graphics
-	Hell has 100 levels
-	3 different modes of play
-	Well-designed levels
-	Achievements and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~    

-	Frustrating at times
-	Some of the beer cans are really hard to spot

8.5/10

A little bit of Hell in your games library will not hurt!

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

So, after being in the closed beta, and playing through pretty much everything in the full release, here is my review of this game:

Pro:
- really cool artstyle and soundtrack
-smooth controls that feel just right for a game that needs precision movement
-it's fun to compete for the top time of a level, whether with friends or on the worldwide leaderboards.
-most speedrun categories you'd come up with for this have in-game leaderboards (individual floors or all levels, with options for collecting secret beers or not and doing no-death or not)
-cool secrets and riddles to figure out
-4 special powers that all have their own obvious and not-so-obvious uses

Cons:
-a few levels might frustrate you, if you are susceptible to getting frustrated at dying a lot in the same place.

That is pretty much it. I can literally not think of any other cons. To me the game is insanely fun. Definitely among my top 5 of this year.

24611726.review:
"Никто не смеет красть моё пиво. НИКТО" (с)

Адовый раннер/платформер с очень динамичным геймплеем и возможностями. Игра начинается с того, что некий демон похищает наше пиво и отрезает руку. Мы отвечаем ему тем же - отнимаем конечность и заменяем ей свою бывшую. С этого момента наша жизнь сводится к прыжкам по платформам в аду и перемещениям по порталам. И всё ради поиска заветных баночек с холодненьким (в аду).

Игра внешне очень схожа со старым добрый "Quake" дизайном и скоростью. Каждый уровень нужно пройти как можно быстрее, а помогать вам в этом будет таблица лидеров (есть отдельный список для друзей). И всё это под сумасшедшие гитарные запилы.

+ динамичный геймплей
+ соревновательная составляющая
+ саундтрек
+ активируемые спец способности (файрболл, левитация)
+ множество достижений

- иногда результат по каким-то причинам не засчитывает
- возможность сгореть

В целом игра получилась, безусловно, отличная, если не считать мелких недочетов с результатами. Сумасшедшие скорости в купе с адским окружением, дополненные шутеечками и таблицей для писькомерства гарантированно увлекут вам на много часов. А если просидите в игре 66 часов - получите специальную ачивку.

24596055.review:
SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell - раннер с элементами головоломок.

Ну чтож, с чего все началось? Главный герой обнаруживает у себя под дверью странный диск, ну долго не задумываясь он вставляет диск в свой магнитофон и тут, от куда не возьмись появляется портал из которого выходит демон. Демон наглым образом украл Ваше пиво, отрезал Вам руку и ушел, но главный герой не растерялся и в дагонку кинул этот странный диск в демона, тем самым отрубил демону руку. За не имением ничего, главный герой решает воспользоваться отрубленной рукой демона как своей. Ну и конечно же, как же жить без пива, поэтому наш герой решает отправиться в Ад, что бы вернуть свое пиво. 

Далее геймплей: он как всегда прост, это же раннер. Бежите из точки A в точку Б. По пути преодолевая смертельные ловушки. Ну и конечно же, во время бега Вы замечаете бутылки с пивом, которые так же не грех собрать, раз уж собрались вернуть свое пиво. 

Графика и музыкальная составляющая: Графика на высоте, для игры такого жанра и для такой  цены собственно. Музыка тоже на высшем уровне, саундтрек подобран просто божественно. Вы даже не замечаете как быстро пролетает время, настолько увлекаетесь процессом. 

Отличная игра за свою цену. Со своеобразным юмором и прикольным сюжетом.Любителям раннеров должно понравится.

24580362.review:
C'est Super Meat Boy en vue FPS.

Le but est de parcourir chaque niveau le plus rapidement possible.
A la base vous pouvez courir, sauter, et lancer des boules de feu servant soit a allumer des brasiers-interrupteurs, soit detruire des trucs (des murs, des mines), soit a faire appareitre des plates-formes solides dans certains cas.
Certains niveaux offrent egalement un pouvoir a ramasser pour la durée du stage, on a de la téléportation, de l'anti gravité et du dédoublement de personnage.

A chaque niveau, vous avez un temps limite a battre pour passer, un temps plus serré qui sert d'objectif secondaire, et également une biere planquée à récuperer. Une idée toute bete, mais qui permet de varier agréablement le rythme du jeu. Et parfois, les chercher vous donnera une astuce pour faire un meilleurs temps en jouant normalement.

Chaque niveau a également son classement en ligne pour les meilleurs temps.

Au moment ou j'écris, j'ai parcouru une quarantaine de niveaux en trois heures, chasse aux temps et aux bieres incluses, et jusqu'ici c'est vraiment pas mal.
Graphiquement c'est assez moche, mais le gameplay et la bande son ratrappent bien.

Essayez donc la démo. Elle contient une douzaine de niveaux, et est assez représentative du debut du jeu.
Les quelques glitches qui y sont présent on été corrigés, et quelques niveaux ont été modifiés, ainsi que quelques graphismes et trucs plus techniques... ce qui fait que votre sauvegarde n'est pas compatible avec le jeu complet, mais la finir a 100% prend trois quart d'heure et refaire ces memes passages avec le jeu complet prend a peine dix minutes.

24579897.review:
I barely ever play speedrunner games, because I want the game to have something special besides fast-paced gameplay, the 'X factor' if you will. SEUM has that special something. Here's why: 

The basic maneuverability is an element in all speedrunner games, but SEUM offers special powerups that completely change the way you have to move and position yourself across the map. 

The levels start out very straight forward, but soon you'll notice your best time is a lot slower than other people's. That's because the level design allows for different paths to be taken! The obvious choice is usually not the best compared to that hidden path you find after a dozen tries, and it's very satisfying to see your time decrease with each shortcut.

That's another thing, you often HAVE to find the hidden paths to even come close to the target times! There's one easy to medium difficulty target time, and a hard one, in every level.

Collectables! Yes indeed, there's a can of beer in every normal level, a couple bacon slices in the bonus levels, and let's leave the rest a surprise ;)

Lastly, the overall satanic theme and heavy metal music fit really well with the speedrunner concept, and there's nothing like it at the time of writing this! 

Two thumbs up from me, 10/10, A+, you get the picture. NOW START RUNNING!!

39382771.review:
[h1]Anyone for a cold one?[/h1]

[h1]Story[/h1] In SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell you end up playing as a simple man with a simple plan, relaxing in front of the tube and enjoying a nice cold beer.  Well you were enjoying them until the big mac daddy devil himself shows up through a portal takes them away from you and when you try to stop him, you lose an arm and so does the dark prince.

Using his own flrey flesh covered appendage, you rock the joint and run through the portal after him to get back your six pack of sweet, savory, ice cold beer.  And boy does he shoot off his mouth too. Especially when you die or run out of time. Yep you are racing the clock in this one to get to the next level and let me tell you folks. It is smokin, sizzling, broiling down there in the depths of hell when you are running for the next level.  Those obstacles will keep you guesing and learning and trying to find the quickest possible route.  But there's more.  Beer is hidden and sometimes it's downright difficult to find faster than you can swing a broom at the top of the dark prince. 

This game was created by pine studio and the level challenges are plenty and speaking of plenty there are plenty of achievements to unlock too. 51 minutes later i was starting to feel a little hot under the collar myself. Sometimes cursing my own luck at having to restart a level over when i'd almost reached the end of the level.  This game gives a new meaning to run like hell!  [h1]Score[/h1]8.4 out of 10

[h1]Sound and music[/h1] By the time you hear the kicking music track while running for victory and the next portal, You start to get a little bit tired of your main character's constant death cries. I would have also liked a few more quips from the dark prince besides just what those you do hear when you die. But the sounds are decent. I would have rocked on with a couple more party pack cruisin and brusin musical beats but what's there is enough to get your groove on while you.   You want well done?  That's what the sounds are like. [h1]Score[/h1] 7.2 out of 10.

[h1]Visuals[/h1] The scenery is broiling hot.  There are rooms, there are portals with chains, there are extra crispy looking pools of firey lava that make you just want to go Woah mama!  The visuals in this game are awesome to look at. Though i sort of get tired of seeing firey lava all over, but at the same time i appreciate the details in every portion of the runs. I like the fact that the place resembles something similar to the Doom genre in terms of outward appearance, even in doom the appearance of hell was staggeringly detailed.  You can expect the same from this game. Giving it that good crisp, clean feel like it was hot out of the oven.  I believe it achieved a good level of success. [h1]Score[/h1]7.9 out of 10.

[h1]Game Mechanics and Controls[/h1] Now here's where things got dicey.  The controls for the keyboard while set in the WASD fashion, are a tiny bit clunky because sometimes as you are running, you try to press space and the game doesn't quite respond with an immediate jump.  Or you might accidentally go a little too far off the path and it's "char broil city baby." I'm calling it right now, better to use a gaming controller with this.  While you can use the keyboard setup with a decent amount of ease, there does remain that minor issue of jump recognition.  There's also a slight problem with the mouse itself staying locked in.  For example in my run through, there was always a secondary cursor on my screen when there should only have been just the hand.  At one point during the game's run through i ended up having to quit because the game sort of froze as i was making a turn.  This game can be run on both a mac and a windows computer, I was using my mac when playing it so maybe that had something to do with it.  But overally the control scheme is fairly decent with the minor exceptions i had towards the jumping. [h1]Score[/h1] 8 out of 10.

[h1]Final thoughts and Overall Gameplay fun[/h1] I'll certainly recommend this game to my friends and family. It's a lot of fun though i sometimes want to pull my hair out at some of the level challenges. But that's another fun factor all it's own, the game is tough. I like a good challenge and this game gives that experience.  I feel all warm and toasty inside when I achieve success, and I feel the frustration build a little bit when I screw up a jump or mis-time a move.  The game is tough and probably better off for older gamers with more patience.  But the game provides so much fun that it's like charbroiled brisket pipping hot right out of the furnace.  I was thinking i might see enemies attacking me at the stage progression but i haven't seen that yet.  I'll keep playing and if something new comes to mind, I'll plug it in here. My final thoughts are as follows.  1. I would like to have a little better on the jumping mechanic, otherwise the game plays very nicely.  2. Some of those beers are locked away in spots that i can't yet figure out how to open, but i'm sure i can figure it out.  3. Take a break here and there. It's a speedrun yes, but it's a speed run with quality.  So those are my thoughts, please do try the game for yourself.  My final fun factor [h1]Score[/h1]8.5 out of 10.

39522947.review:
L'un des meilleurs jeux de speedruns possible. L'univers infernal et la musique metal n'est clairement pas mon truc, mais le jeu a un charme absolument unique !
Des centaines et centaines de secrets, environ 105 niveaux tous améliorables et refaisable a l'infini, un systeme de création de map assez simple et très polyvalent.
Des bières cachées dans TOUS les niveaux, permettant d'acceder a d'autres niveaux encore, des flashcodes cachés dans les cartes qui nous redirige la plupart du temps sur des musiques métal sur youtube.
Une physique très sympa avec des sorts qui viennent pimenter le tout : Téléportation, Gravité, Remontée dans le temps.
La possibilité de regarder les runs des Top10 Mondiaux pour comprendre les chemins a prendre (Les joueurs pros sont très actifs et très sympas)
J'en suis actuellement a une 70aine heures de jeu et je continue a améliorer mes temps, créer des maps.
Le DLC est très sympa, car il ajoute de nouveaux sorts, de nouveaux secrets, de nouvelles cartes....
C'est un grand oui ! Et un super 16/20. J'enlève 4 points pour le manque de mises a jour, le jeu légerement mal optimisé.
Mais OH QUE oui je vous le recommande je n'arrive pas a m'arrêter d'y jouer
